SAN FRANCISCO (MarketWatch) -- Brookfield Asset Management Inc. BAM, -1.07% on Wednesday said its board of directors approved a three-for-two stock split and an increase in dividend.
The split will be implemented by way of a stock dividend, with shareholders receiving one additional share for every two shares held.
The stock dividend will be payable on May 12 to shareholders of record at the close of business on May 5.
Shares of Brookfield rose 1.9% in after-hours trading, after ending Wednesday's regular session up 2%.
The goal is to improve the liquidity of the shares, the company said.
The stock split will not dilute shareholders' equity, it said.
Brookfield manages more than $200 billion in assets.
